intro: Costus erythrocoryne, commonly known as the red-veined costus, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features tall, leafy stems with striking red veins on its lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with a subtle fragrance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
